page.title: 18 DATA TRACK TECHNOLOGY
page.content: Data Track Technology is a company that makes computer peripherals. It started in the front two bedrooms of 64 Ringwood Road, Highcliffe and now has a factory in New Milton. There are 14 people working at the factory and the hours of work are from 8:30 am to 5:30 pm. About 12 disk drives are made per day and about 10 to 20 cartridge tape systems are made per week. The company moved into 7 Queensway, New Milton in August 1982. The companies who buy the products are British Telecom, BMW, Plessey and CEGB. The company has a turnover of half a million pounds per year. The factory's size is 5000 square feet. The school is using Data Track Technology's disk drives in the{Domesday Project.}The directors of DTT are Michael William Woolley and Derek Higgins. By Michael Joe Woolley.
